item.title: We are poor judges of how innovative our ideas are
item.description: Early into a specific field we feel we are doing innovative things that are not novel or new. As we spend more time with a field we feel like we are being less innovative, but are actually being more innovative.
item.content:encoded:
Early into a specific field we feel we are doing innovative things that are not novel or new. As we spend more time with a field we feel like we are being less innovative, but are actually being more innovative. We are poor judges of how innovative our ideas are. This is another form of the Curse of Knowledge.

item.content:encoded:
https://github.com/jasonrudolph/keyboard

Written by Jason Rudolph

I don’t use this directly as parts of it I don’t need, but this was a huge inspiration for what I run as my Karabiner and Hammerspoon configs.

Key aspects for me:

  • Super Duper Mode
    • HJKL arrows
      • with good support for jumping back and forward a word by holding A, as well as selection support by holding space bar.
    • Easy Tab Switching in Chrome and Obsidian with YUIO
    • Alt + H to delete previous word
    • Alt + L to delete next word

item.title: Herman Miller Embody
item.description: Initial Reactions 2022-04-04 Great casters Excellent lower back support Doesn’t push my shoulders forward. This was the reason I had to get rid of the Secret Labs Omega Very comfortable for Desk work.
item.content:encoded:
Initial Reactions 2022-04-04

  • Great casters
  • Excellent lower back support
  • Doesn’t push my shoulders forward. This was the reason I had to get rid of the Secret Labs Omega
  • Very comfortable for Desk work. This is a very good fit with the contour Fully Jarvis Desk I use.
  • The armrests don’t both me nearly as much as other people have noted, but I’m also not a big armrest user.
  • The sync fabric is great and a significant upgrade over the previous Balance & Rhythm fabrics.
  • The front of the chair is very creaky where the depth adjustment is.
    • I’m going to get some white lithium grease tomorrow and grease it. A guide for this is available here

2022-04-05

  • I greased the seat depth adjustment as outlined in the guide above and after letting it work in for a bit the squeaking is gone.
  • It also seemed like pulling one side out a little further until it clicked made a big difference. Basically, when you think you’ve got it even on both sides, pull one side out until it clicks again.

2022-04-06

  • I feel like I have gotten the seat adjusted like I want it now.
  • I have some back fatigue when I sit in it for long periods of time, but I believe that is largely due to the chair forcing my lumbar into the correct position, and I need to build up strength in new areas to support that. The fatigue is not great and honestly my back feels excellent when I wake up each morning. I’m hopeful that it will subside in the coming days. Aside from that, I am absolutely loving the chair. The upper back support and my posture seem improved.

item.title: Whoever best describes the problem is the one most likely to solve it

item.title: Wordle
item.description: Wordle has been great as it has reconnected me with my best friend. Wordle has given us a connection point each day when we chat over text message. Two key aspects are that there is only one each day and that everyone is working on the same one.
item.content:encoded: Wordle has been great as it has reconnected me with my best friend. Wordle has given us a connection point each day when we chat over text message. Two key aspects are that there is only one each day and that everyone is working on the same one. The limited manner gives each guess more weight and also ensures people don’t binge it and grow tired of it. The fact everyone is working on the same puzzle is what adds to the social element of the game.

item.title: Daily Reflection
item.description: On each daily note I have a slot for reflection. The template I’ve used for a while now is: Reflection What did I learn / accomplish? * What did I do for exercise?
item.content:encoded:
On each daily note I have a slot for reflection. The template I’ve used for a while now is:

Reflection

  • What did I learn / accomplish? *

  • What did I do for exercise?

  • Any special thoughts? *

  • How could I have made today better? *

It is nice and thorough, but I’ve found myself more and more not doing daily reflection because it pulls away from other things that need my attention, so today I’m trying swapping it to just a single line: “Today was a good day because:”
